passage.text: The use of tree harvesting can enable the analysis of gene expression data and the discovery of intriguing clusters of genes that require further investigation.

In this study, we use a new statistical method called gene shaving to identify groups of elements (genes) that exhibit coherent expression and are optimal for different properties of the variation in their expression.

This exploratory study demonstrates "...any association between the polymorphisms in codon 27 of ADRB2 and in [ADRB3] genes that may be associated with increased risk of breast cancer"; however, additional studies across larger samples and/or across different ethnicities are needed to further explore this effect.
